title.value: Pre-Training Protein Encoder via Siamese Sequence-Structure Diffusion Trajectory Prediction
title.justification: It is the title of the paper.
title.quote: Pre-Training Protein Encoder via Siamese Sequence-Structure Diffusion Trajectory Prediction

extractions.description: The paper proposes DiffPreT, a novel pre-training approach for protein encoders by modeling the joint distribution of protein sequences and structures using denoising diffusion models. This method integrates joint diffusion trajectories to capture inter-atomic interactions and residue type dependencies. The research further introduces SiamDiff, an enhanced version of DiffPreT, which captures conformational variations by maximizing mutual information between representations of diffusion trajectories of correlated conformers. Extensive experiments demonstrate the effectiveness and superior performance of both methods on various protein understanding tasks.

type.justification: The paper conducts experimental evaluations to demonstrate the effectiveness and performance of the proposed methods DiffPreT and SiamDiff on various tasks.
type.quote: Experimental results show that the performance of DiffPreT is consistently competitive on all tasks, and SiamDiff achieves new state-of-the-art performance

name.justification: The paper focuses on protein structure and sequence analysis using computational models.
name.quote: Self-supervised pre-training methods on proteins have recently gained attention

name.justification: The paper involves the use of algorithms and models to understand biological data, specifically protein sequences and structures.
name.quote: we propose the DiffPreT approach to pre-train a protein encoder by sequence-structure joint diffusion modeling

name.justification: The core methodology includes self-supervised learning and diffusion models, which are subfields of machine learning.
name.quote: Based on this intuition, in this section, we explore the application of joint diffusion models on pre-training protein encoders in a pre-training and fine-tuning framework.

name.justification: DiffPreT is the primary pre-training approach introduced in the paper.
name.quote: we propose the DiffPreT approach to pre-train a protein encoder by sequence-structure joint diffusion modeling.

is_contributed.justification: DiffPreT is introduced and proposed by the authors of the paper.

is_executed.justification: There is no specific mention of the hardware used for executing DiffPreT in the provided extract.

is_compared.justification: DiffPreT's performance is evaluated and compared across various tasks.
is_compared.quote: Experimental results show that the performance of DiffPreT is consistently competitive on all tasks

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no referenced paper for DiffPreT since it is a new contribution.

name.justification: SiamDiff is introduced as an enhancement to DiffPreT.
name.quote: we enhance DiffPreT by a method called Siamese Diffusion Trajectory Prediction (SiamDiff)

is_contributed.justification: SiamDiff is introduced and proposed by the authors of the paper.
is_contributed.quote: we propose Siamese Diffusion Trajectory Prediction (SiamDiff)

is_executed.justification: There is no specific mention of the hardware used for executing SiamDiff in the provided extract.

is_compared.justification: SiamDiff's performance is evaluated and compared across various tasks, with claims of achieving state-of-the-art results in some cases.

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no referenced paper for SiamDiff since it is a new contribution.
